title: fix(ivy): ensure template styles/classes are applied before directives are instantiated

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
Angular Ivy interprets inline static style/class attribute values as instructions that
are processed whilst an element gets created. Because these inline style values are
referenced by style/class bindings, their inline style values are applied at a later
stage. Despite them being eventually applied, their values should be applied earlier
before any directives are instantiated so that directive code can rely on any inline
style/class changes.

This patch ensures that all static style/class attribute values are applied (rendered)
on the element before directives are instantiated.

Jira Issue: FW-1133

title: CI: Merge script should fail if there are fixups after merge

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
We have a merge script here:

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/scripts/github/merge-pr

Caretakers use this script to merge PRs that are green. However, we've been noticing issues lately where fixup commits sometimes aren't squashed as expected and make it into master. 

Latest example:

https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/28296
https://github.com/angular/angular/commits/master

In that case, it seems like it happened because the message in the fixup commit didn't match any commit messages before it. 

It would be nice if the merge script could check to see if there are fixup commits remaining after merge and throw a friendly error. This would prevent caretakers from accidentally muddying the commit history with a bad squash.

title: fix(common): remove deprecated support for intl API

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
BREAKING CHANGE:

In v5, we deprecated support for the intl API in order to improve the browser support. We are now removing these deprecated APIs for v8. See the original change here for more info on why: #18284.

title: feat(ivy): use i18n locale data to determine the plural form of ICU expressions

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
Plural ICU expressions depend on the locale (different languages have different plural forms). Until now the locale was hard coded as `en-US`.
This PR refactors all of the localization code that was previously living in `@angular/common`. Everything but the locale data has been moved to `@angular/core`, making it possible to get the correct plural form. Since we plan on refactoring all of this later and we didn't want to create a breaking change for that now, everything is still publicly exported by `@angular/common`, but the code is actually in `@angular/core`, making it possible to use it in core (core cannot import from common).
For compatibility reasons, if you use ivy with AOT and bootstrap your app with `bootstrapModule` then the `LOCALE_ID` token will be set automatically for ivy, which is then used to get the correct plural form.
⚠️ For JIT you need to call `ɵsetLocaleId` manually to define the `LOCALE_ID` before bootstrap. Same thing if you don't use the compat mode and start your app with `renderComponent`. We expect this to change once we start adding the new i18n APIs, so don't rely on this function (there's a reason why it's a private export).

### Description

The now deprecated dynamic version of ngUpgrade used to have a [list of supported/unsupported features][1].
It would be a good idea to have a similar list for the new (static) ngUpgrade (e.g. in [UpgradeComponent][2] API docs).

title: Add Official Schematics documentation

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
# 📚 Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description
Hello. I just spend some time creating my first schematics. Have to say it's awesome! Unfortunately, I had to spend much of my time reading throughout the angular @schematics code to see examples of how it works and articles on Medium by other people about how to create a basic schematic.

It would be awesome if the Angular team spends some time making an awesome documentation of such an awesome feature! This has so much potential to be wildly used, and I'm afraid that without proper documentation, it won't reach the masses!

Just try to google a simple example of `How to copy a file in angular schematics`, and there is no simple link to it. I ended up reading a file via the `tree.read` into a `buffer`, transforming the file into a `string`, and then creating a new one via `tree.create`, but don't even know if this is standard or not 🤷‍♀️ 

In any case, I love schematics, but there is no official documentation at all other than two blog post (one with unit test) with simple examples you guys created in the Angular Medium Blog.

Thanks! Nice job!

milestone.title: needsTriage

body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? Yes ### Description I am using Firestore to create dynamic router links with an ngFor statement, the Routerlink does not work as documented. If I just put [routerLink]=['item.link] it does not produce the correct root url/baseref. I have tried every variance of this possible. routerLink['../'+item.link] routerlink={{item.link}} if I enter ['../'+item.link] the href is correct but routing does not function properly. If I just use href the routing works correctly. `
  • {{item.link}} ` ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 
    
Angular CLI: 7.3.4
Node: 10.0.0
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 7.2.8
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic

title: fix(compiler): inherit param types when class has a constructor which…

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
… takes no declared parameters and delegates up

In ReflectionCapabilities, when checking for own parameters of a type, inherit the types properly for classes that do have a constructor, but the constructor takes no declared parameters and just delegates to super(...arguments). This removes the need to declare trivial constructors in such classes to make them work properly in JIT mode. Without this, DI fails and injectables are undefined.

title: docs: remove  label 'PR action: review'
body: We are removing this label as it's now obsolete. We use Github PR review process instead.

title: Add file structure section to Creating Libraries

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Milestone for triaged issues that have not yet been scheduled for resolution.

body:
# 📚 Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

The new [Project Files Structure](https://angular.io/guide/file-structure) page for v8 references [Creating Libraries](https://angular.io/guide/creating-libraries) for more information on the file structure of libraries. 

To make the reference true, we need to add a file-structure section to [Creating Libraries](https://angular.io/guide/creating-libraries) guide. The structure will change in v8, so that should be the target. 

### What's the affected URL? 

 [Creating Libraries](https://angular.io/guide/creating-libraries) 

Possibly also add a more specific reference to [Project Files Structure](https://angular.io/guide/file-structure).

title: Bug in create_url_tree.ts

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
Routing fails, if null is provided as routing parameter.

To resolve this, check your function createNewSegmentGroup(segmentGroup, startIndex, commands) {...} on line 272 (https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/router/src/create_url_tree.ts#L272 / commit https://github.com/angular/angular/commit/091a504377782b9338a9d7916f84fb18c5bbdcc2) and check additionally `commands[i]` for not null.

title: @angular/compiler-cli declarations bug: has no exported member 'NgTools_InternalApi_NG_2'

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
<!--🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅

Oh hi there! 😄

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->


# 🐞 bug report

### Affected Package
@angular/compiler-cli

### Description

Wrong TypeScript declaration file.

## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction

package.json:
```json
{
  "name": "compiler-cli-declarations-bug",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "main": "index.js",
  "license": "MIT",
  "devDependencies": {
    "@angular/compiler": "7.2.8",
    "@angular/compiler-cli": "7.2.8",
    "@types/node": "11.11.0",
    "typescript": "3.3.3333"
  }
}
```

index.ts:
```typescript
import {readConfiguration} from "@angular/compiler-cli";

console.log(typeof readConfiguration);

```

Command to execute:
```
npx tsc --strict --noEmitOnError --lib es2015,dom index.ts
```

## 🔥 Exception or Error
```
node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/index.d.ts:20:10 - error TS2305: Module '"@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtools_api"' has no exported member 'NgTools_InternalApi_NG_2'.

20 export { NgTools_InternalApi_NG_2 as __NGTOOLS_PRIVATE_API_2 } from './src/ngtools_api';
            ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Found 2 errors.
```

![img](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1560781/54127946-ff53d280-441b-11e9-86c9-27de7db9e57d.png)

## Anything else relevant?

Adding `--skipLibCheck` TypeScript compiler option is a workaround:
```
npx tsc --strict --noEmitOnError --lib es2015,dom --skipLibCheck index.ts
```

title: writeValue gets called before ngOnInit

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package `@angular/forms` ### Is this a regression? I don't know. I don't think so. ### Description When `NgControl` is injected into the constructor of a component and the value accessor is set manually to avoid `cyclic dependency errors`, `writeValue` is called before `ngOnInit`. This workaround is suggested by the [Material Angular doc](https://material.angular.io/guide/creating-a-custom-form-field-control#-code-ngcontrol-code-) under `ngControl`. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction [Stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-form-control-bug) ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 7.3.5
Node: 11.9.0
OS: win32 x64
Angular: 7.2.8
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router, service-worker

-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.13.5
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.13.5
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.13.5
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.13.5
@angular-devkit/core              7.3.5
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.3.5
@angular/cdk                      7.3.3
@angular/cli                      7.3.5
@angular/material                 7.3.3
@angular/pwa                      0.13.5
@ngtools/webpack                  7.3.5
@schematics/angular               7.3.5
@schematics/update                0.13.5
rxjs                              6.4.0
typescript                        3.2.4
webpack                           4.29.0
**Anything else relevant?** I was sent here by the @angular/material2 team. They believe it's an issue with `@angular/forms`. [https://github.com/angular/material2/issues/15434](https://github.com/angular/material2/issues/15434)

title: Navigation with custom Animation and :Increment :decrement does not work as expected

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body: # 🐞 bug report ### Description We try to create a lazy loaded wizzard/stepper using router and custom navigation. We register a custom animation named **loginRouteSlideInAnimation** which has an `:increment` and `:decrement` transition What we do, when we go to next page we would like to slide in new page from right and if we go to previous page we would like to slide in new page from right. We do this with this custom animation trigger The strange thing is, if we run this locally with ng serve the navigation animation is not working as expected, go to NEXT page does not perform any animation until we go on a PREVIOUS page and also from the other side, on first PREVIOUS page does not perform any animation until we go on NEXT page. What we can see `(query(':enter))` has no results in the situation where the animation is not working. But it should! You can test the app on stackblitz, where the APP is working well. But please clone our repo and check it locally where it is not working as expected and like in the stackblitz. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/github/mburger81/test-animation https://github.com/mburger81/test-animation

🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅🔅-->

# 📚 Docs wrong link report

### Description

Wrong link: At https://angular.io/guide/complex-animation-sequences all group() links redirects to https://angular.io/api/forms/FormBuilder#group which, I believe, is wrong!


## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction

### Reproduction Steps**
<!-- If applicable please list the steps to take to reproduce the issue -->
1) Go to https://angular.io/guide/complex-animation-sequences
2) Click any group() link

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
<!-- If applicable please describe the difference between the expected and actual behavior after following the repro steps. -->
<!-- ✍️edit:-->
Apparently group() link on animation docs page should refer to https://angular.io/api/animations/group 


## 🌍  Your Environment

### Browser info
<!-- ✍️Is this a browser specific issue? If so, please specify the device, browser, and version. -->
Chromium
Version 72.0.3626.121 (Official Build) Arch Linux (64-bit)
### Anything else relevant?
<!-- ✍️Please provide additional info if necessary. -->

title: Navigating back in iframe in IE is not recognized by router

milestone.title: needsTriage
milestone.description: Milestone for all issues that haven't been triaged yet

body:
# 🐞 bug report ### Affected Package Given that this a routing issue I assume `@angular/router` is the cause. ### Is this a regression? I am not sure if this issue occurred in earlier versions, but as the application migrated form 5 -> 6 (after we implemented the routing feature, see below) some time ago, I can only guess that with Angular 5 routing worked as expected. Otherwise the error would have been noticed earlier. ### Description I am currently developing a micro-frontend website which uses iframes to load different applications into it. The architecture of the project can be best described visually: ![iframe-setup](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18900196/53732941-b4681700-3e7f-11e9-868e-4bb22ed0b8d8.png) The issue here is the inner iframe. If it navigates to some route, say from `module/route` to `module/feat` the history is filled correctly, so both URLs will be in the history. However, if I click the browser back button and the state is popped, Angular in the inner iframe will fail to detect the URL change. I have verified, that the URL of the iframe is correct by executing `iframe.contentWindow.location.href`. Same holds true if I inject `Location` from `@angular/common`. All other browsers (including Edge) detect the URL change and correctly open the previous route. ## 🔬 Minimal Reproduction This is where it becomes tricky. I created a minimal setup on Gitlab: https://gitlab.com/Znert/angular-iframe-navigation-bug However, this project does **not** reproduce the error. If you start the project and navigate inside the iframe and go back, everything works fine. Hence all I can provide you with is a link to our (German) production site: [onfarming.at](https://onfarming.at) If you want to reproduce the error there, you have to sign in/up first (using Google, Facbeook or just use a throwaway email - just fill the fields `E-Mail Adresse`, `Passwort` and `Passwort wiederholen`, I guess you can figure out which requires what). Then you will come to the dashboard. The easiest way to navigate within iframes is if you click on "Pflanzenschutz". Once there, use the search in the top card "Produkte finden" and enter "amistar opti". Click on any match. This will cause a navigate to the product detail page. Now you can press the back button ("Zurück") on the top left of the iframe, or the browser back. Nothing will happen. Validate, that the iframe's url changed by getting the (only) iframe on the page and call `iframe.contentWindow.location.href`. ## 🌍 Your Environment **Angular Version:** All our micro-frontends have been upgraded to Angular 7 recently, but the error occurred while on 6 as well. The following output is of one of the inner micro-frontends, but the versions are pretty much identical between each other: 

     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / △ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/
    

Angular CLI: 7.3.2
Node: 8.14.1
OS: linux x64
Angular: 7.2.6
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... http, language-service, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                           Version
-----------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect         0.13.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular     0.13.2
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer   0.13.2
@angular-devkit/build-webpack     0.13.2
@angular-devkit/core              7.3.2
@angular-devkit/schematics        7.3.2
@angular/cli                      7.3.2
@ngtools/webpack                  7.3.2
@schematics/angular               7.3.2
@schematics/update                0.13.2
rxjs                              6.4.0
typescript                        3.2.4
webpack                           4.29.0
**Anything else relevant?** This issue was found on IE 11 on Windows 10. Older versions of IE and Windows have not been tested. Other browser do not have the issue (to the best of my knowledge). I researched the topic and found the following two relevant posts: https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/platform/issues/15513159/ https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/9497 However, neither of them provide a solution (and the second one even is for AngularJS...).
